    • saveRep

      public void saveRep​(org.pentaho.di.repository.Repository rep, org.pentaho.metastore.api.IMetaStore metaStore, org.pentaho.di.repository.ObjectId id_transformation, org.pentaho.di.repository.ObjectId id_step) throws org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException
      This method is called by Spoon when a step needs to serialize its configuration to a repository. The repository implementation provides the necessary methods to save the step attributes.
      Specified by:
      saveRep in interface org.pentaho.di.trans.step.StepMetaInterface
      Overrides:
      saveRep in class org.pentaho.di.trans.step.BaseStepMeta
      Parameters:
      rep - the repository to save to
      metaStore - the metaStore to optionally write to
      id_transformation - the id to use for the transformation when saving
      id_step - the id to use for the step when saving
      Throws:
      org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException

    • readRep

      public void readRep​(org.pentaho.di.repository.Repository rep, org.pentaho.metastore.api.IMetaStore metaStore, org.pentaho.di.repository.ObjectId id_step, java.util.List<org.pentaho.di.core.database.DatabaseMeta> databases) throws org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException
      This method is called by PDI when a step needs to read its configuration from a repository. The repository implementation provides the necessary methods to read the step attributes.
      Specified by:

      Overrides:

      Parameters:
      rep - the repository to read from
      metaStore - the metaStore to optionally read from
      id_step - the id of the step being read
      databases - the databases available in the transformation
      Throws:
      org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException

    • getXML

      public java.lang.String getXML() throws org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleValueException
      This method is called by Spoon when a step needs to serialize its configuration to XML. The expected return value is an XML fragment consisting of one or more XML tags. Please use org.pentaho.di.core.xml.XMLHandler to conveniently generate the XML.
      Specified by:
      getXML in interface org.pentaho.di.trans.step.StepMetaInterface
      Overrides:
      getXML in class org.pentaho.di.trans.step.BaseStepMeta
      Returns:
      a string containing the XML serialization of this step
      Throws:
      org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleValueException

    • loadXML

      public void loadXML​(org.w3c.dom.Node stepnode, java.util.List<org.pentaho.di.core.database.DatabaseMeta> databases, org.pentaho.metastore.api.IMetaStore metaStore) throws org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleXMLException
      This method is called by PDI when a step needs to load its configuration from XML. Please use org.pentaho.di.core.xml.XMLHandler to conveniently read from the XML node passed in.

      databases - the databases available in the transformation
      metaStore - the metaStore to optionally read from

    • clone

      public java.lang.Object clone()

    • getFields

      public void getFields​(org.pentaho.di.core.row.RowMetaInterface inputRowMeta, java.lang.String name, org.pentaho.di.core.row.RowMetaInterface[] info, org.pentaho.di.trans.step.StepMeta nextStep, org.pentaho.di.core.variables.VariableSpace space, org.pentaho.di.repository.Repository repository, org.pentaho.metastore.api.IMetaStore metaStore) throws org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleStepException
      This method is called to determine the changes the step is making to the row-stream. To that end a RowMetaInterface object is passed in, containing the row-stream structure as it is when entering the step. This method must apply any changes the step makes to the row stream. Usually a step adds fields to the row-stream.
      Specified by:
      getFields in interface org.pentaho.di.trans.step.StepMetaInterface
      Overrides:
      getFields in class org.pentaho.di.trans.step.BaseStepMeta
      Parameters:
      inputRowMeta - the row structure coming in to the step
      name - the name of the step making the changes
      info - row structures of any info steps coming in
      nextStep - the description of a step this step is passing rows to
      space - the variable space for resolving variables
      repository - the repository instance optionally read from
      metaStore - the metaStore to optionally read from
      Throws:
      org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleStepException

    • check

      public void check​(java.util.List<org.pentaho.di.core.CheckResultInterface> remarks, org.pentaho.di.trans.TransMeta transMeta, org.pentaho.di.trans.step.StepMeta stepMeta, org.pentaho.di.core.row.RowMetaInterface prev, java.lang.String[] input, java.lang.String[] output, org.pentaho.di.core.row.RowMetaInterface info, org.pentaho.di.core.variables.VariableSpace space, org.pentaho.di.repository.Repository repository, org.pentaho.metastore.api.IMetaStore metaStore)
      This method is called when the user selects the "Verify Transformation" option in Spoon. A list of remarks is passed in that this method should add to. Each remark is a comment, warning, error, or ok. The method should perform as many checks as necessary to catch design-time errors. Typical checks include: - verify that all mandatory configuration is given - verify that the step receives any input, unless it's a row generating step - verify that the step does not receive any input if it does not take them into account - verify that the step finds fields it relies on in the row-stream
      Specified by:
      check in interface org.pentaho.di.trans.step.StepMetaInterface
      Overrides:
      check in class org.pentaho.di.trans.step.BaseStepMeta
      Parameters:
      remarks - the list of remarks to append to
      transMeta - the description of the transformation
      stepMeta - the description of the step
      prev - the structure of the incoming row-stream
      input - names of steps sending input to the step
      output - names of steps this step is sending output to
      info - fields coming in from info steps
      metaStore - metaStore to optionally read from
